column9:
This table shows the Spring 2025 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It captures both undergraduate and graduate instructional activity and converts totals into standardized FTE enrollments.

By School (Spring 2025):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest unit, generating 47,765 credit hours, equal to 3,218 FTEs.

Business – produced 15,234 credit hours, translating into 1,042 FTEs.

Education – contributed 5,622 credit hours, supporting 424 FTEs.

Health & Rehabilitation Sciences – delivered 9,371 credit hours, for 678 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – the second-largest unit, with 33,439 credit hours, equating to 2,264 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – credit hours taught at each level.

Total Credit Hours – combined UG + GR load.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollments (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
